The Commander X16 is a modern 8-bit computer designed by David Murray, also known as "The 8-Bit Guy." It aims to capture the simplicity and charm of classic 8-bit computers like the Commodore 64 while providing enhanced capabilities and modern conveniences.
The X16 features a WDC 65C02 CPU running at 8 MHz, up to 2 MB of RAM, and a VERA video and audio chip that supports high-resolution graphics and advanced sound. It runs a custom version of BASIC and includes a variety of expansion options, making it a versatile platform for retro computing enthusiasts and hobbyists.
